intro: Ruellia maravilla, commonly known as the Marvelous Ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in whorls at the ends of the stems. Ruellia maravilla is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
